fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Allow using expand macro with keyboard.
At the moment the macro is not accessible meaning it can't be tabbed through and expanded without mouse interaction. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Confluence page 
 # Add expand macros

h3. Expected Results
Users can expand and collapse the content using the keyboard.

h3. Actual Results
User need to use the mouse in order to work with the macro

h3. Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Allow using expand macro with keyboard

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team members are unable to remove members from a team whose status shows "INVITED". If a user does not have an Atlassian account previously and is being invited on a site and being added to a team before accepting site invite, the member status shows "INVITED" in a team. However, after accepting site invite as well, the status of member still remains as "INVITED" in a team, because of which it cannot be removed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Invite a new user for Atlassian site access.
 # Add the newly invited user in a team through "<sitename>.atlassian.net/people" .
 # The status of user will be shown as "INVITED" in team membership.
 # Once the user accepts the site invite, the status in team membership is still "INVITED".
 # This user cannot be removed from the team membership.

h3. Expected Results

Once the user accepts site access, the team membership should be changed from INVITED to a team member with (...) option available .
h3. Actual Results

The user status still remains "INVITED" in team membership, also it is impossible/manage the user in the team.
h3. Workaround

No workaround available currently
fields.summary: Unable to remove member from People team with status INVITED

fields.description: ...to narrow down list of displayed groups instead of only displaying 100% matches or all by using "*".
fields.summary: Allow more wildcards/strings  in userlister macro...

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With the [introduction of the new Confluence search|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Search-like-a-pro-with-the-new-advanced-search-experience/td-p/1183423], when the user uses the *Advanced search*, it will bring a new experience of searching. However, when using a macro like the *Livesearch* one, by using the option for the full search, it will redirect the user to the older search model.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Confluence page.
# Edit the page and insert the *Livesearch* macro.
# Publish the page
# Try to search within the macro's search field and hit "Enter" or tap the magnifying glass button

h3. Expected Results
It should redirect the user to the new search.

h3. Actual Results
It redirects the user to the old search model.

h3. Workaround

The old search works properly. If the user wants to use the new search, you can tap the *Advanced search* button that is displayed on the bottom of the sidebar after executing a quick search.
fields.summary: Hitting enter/tapping the full search on the Livesearch macro redirects to the old search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Similar to [the suggestion to the suggestion to have the Livesearch macro autocomplete to suggest results after a couple of letters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39920], when the user types some words, a few results will be displayed. However, for specific page titles, the result will only come after the full word/title is searched, which makes this bug a bit different from the suggestion.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a few pages with a similar title (e.g. test1,  test2, test3, and test4).
# Create more pages with titles with a small sentence, or, that would not be similar (e.g. test Atlassian, new test).
# Create a new page.
# Edit and add the *Livesearch* macro.
# Publish the page.
# Search for the created pages

h3. Expected Results
All the results should be retrieved with the same behavior.

h3. Actual Results
Different from the quick search, for some of the titles, they will only be displayed after matching the full title, while for others,  partial words already help. 

A video has been attached to demonstrate the behavior working with a partial search for some words, while others need to be fully searched:

 [^livesearch.mp4] 

h3. Workaround

Use the full/quick search of Confluence. Alternatively, you can try to search for the full word.
fields.summary: Searching in the Livesearch macro brings inconsistent results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, when having JIRA or Confluence opened to anonymous users these anonymous users can click on the names of the licensed users that have worked on a page.

This click leads the anonymous user into the person profile which then throws a "something went wrong" error and asks the person to log in.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page in Confluence to anonymous users.
# Access the page on an incognito tab.
# Click on the profile/name of a user present on the open page.

h3. Expected Results

The page should identify the user that's trying to load the profile was accessing an anonymous page and handle things better.

h3. Actual Results

After getting the error message the user is requested to enter his credentials and log in.

h3. Workaround
---
fields.summary: Something went wrong when loading user profile as an anonymous user

fields.description:
h3. Issue
- If you have included personal data in free-form text, either typed into content spaces or as a custom field label, you will need to use the product's global search feature to surface this personal data and delete it manually on a case-by-case basis. Currently, Confluence doesn't provide an option to automatically delete personal data added as a text on pages or spaces.

h3. Suggested solution 
- Provide an option to auto-delete personal data in a free-form text after a period of time
fields.summary: Provide an option to auto delete personal data in free-form text after a period of time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you have a Children Display macro in a subsection of the page. Adding a Table of Contents will automatically include these subpages links in the list. However, the links to subpages are not working. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Page (Parent Page)
# Create "Child page 1" under Parent Page
# Edit Parent page and add a heading "Pages"
# Under Pages insert an Expand Macro 
# Inside Expand Macro, add a Children Display macro (heading 3)
# Add a Table of Contents 

h3. Expected Results
- Links to subpages in Table of Contents should be working

h3. Actual Results
- Links to subpages in Table of Contents are broken 

h3. Workaround
- Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Links to subpages in Table of Contents are broken

fields.description: Please allow copying an entire table from one section of a page to another in a page in Confluence. Recreating the same table takes a lot of time with adding columns etc one by one and then copy pasting information.
fields.summary: Please allow copying an entire table from one section of a page to another in a page in Confluence.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Inline Comments on Confluence pages user Profile box are behaving strangely
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add text to a page
 # Add comment(s)
 # Mouse over user name
 # Profile Contact card is displayed and the behaviour is unpredictable

h3. Expected Results

Contact Popup should be displayed after mouse over
h3. Actual Results

Contact popup is displayed and remains after mouseover. (See Video)
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Hover over Mentions/Names in inline comments profile Box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Multi-byte users cannot select the macro from slash command when using Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install and activate a Japanese IME(ex: https://www.google.co.jp/ime/)
# Using Firefox, open a page
# Type slash and "ステータス(sute-tasu)"
# Hit Enter to confirm the character to use

h3. Expected Results
The dropdown to select the macro will show( [^Chrome_expected.mov] )

h3. Actual Results
The dropdown to won't be shown and the user cannot select a macro ( [^actual_Firefox.mov] )

h3. Workaround
* Enter only slash and select the macro from the list
* Use Chrome
fields.summary: Multi-byte users cannot select the macro from slash command when using Firefox

fields.description:
Sometimes there are many small changes that happen to a document between major releases. It would be nice to be able to create more complex version history for documents so that you can easily find the major releases of documents. ie: version 1.0, 1.2, 1.3, and then a a jump to version 2.0 for the next major release.

 

If this isn't possible maybe there would be a way to flag certain versions as release documents?
fields.summary: Different Version Numbering Schemes for Page History

fields.description:
Currently there doesn't seem to be any UI way to add a change comment when publishing new changes on a document even though when looking at the page history there there is an entire column for these comments.

I found a community support page on it and there was a suggestion to use a REST request to add these comments. However, this isn't a good work around for our now technical staff.
fields.summary: Add a History Comment Using the UI When Publishing New Changes

fields.description: Items in Space's trash bin are sorted by ABC which is not useful in many cases. Will be more useful to sort them by date so you can see which items were recently deleted, or at list have the option to do so.
fields.summary: Trashed items should be sorted by date trashed (ascending order)

fields.description:
I created a gorgeous page using the new editor and inserted a number of SVG images, some using the "Images & Files" importer, some using drag'n'drop. While in edit mode, everything looked great. Now that I published my changes, the SVG images have been converted to very low-quality JPEGs that are an eyesore on HiDPI screens.

It there a way to avoid this unwelcome conversion?
fields.summary: SVG files are converted to crappy JPEGs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence site backup to server is exporting all users as inactive.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access your Confluence Cloud instance;
# Go to Backup Manager;
# Create a site backup to Confluence Server

h3. Expected Results
All inactive users will be exported as inactive.

h3. Actual Results
All inactive users are exported as active.

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Confluence site backup to server is exporting all users as inactive

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we were creating a *File List* page using this blueprint, we added the title of the page, its description, and restrictions on the page. After hitting the *Create* button, it would create an already published page with the description we typed and the *Attachments* macro.
After a recent change, instead of creating a published page, Confluence directs us to a draft one, making us have an additional step of hitting the Publish button.

h3. Suggestion
* Revert the way this template works to the way it was before this change, as it impacts when we are creating multiple File Lists in Confluence.
fields.summary: File List blueprint doesn't create a published page anymore
Content Report Table macro break links in HTML export

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary It's not possible to create links ("/link") to Pages that have titles with a new line. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a new Page and publish it; # Create another new Page and set the title of this new Page with two lines (you can't write a new line in the title in Confluence but you can Copy it from an editor); # Publish this new Page; # Edit the first Page created, type "/link" and choose the Page with new line in the title; # Publish the page and try to reopen it; h3. Expected Results The page opens without problems. h3. Actual Results The page opens with no content on it and a pop-up error message appears: _We couldn't display your content. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support_. Additionally, if you try to edit the page, another pop-up error message appears: _We couldn't load the editor. Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support_. h3. Additional notes * The following error is thrown at the console: {code:none}ContentRenderer.tsx:29 Invalid adf document SyntaxError: Unexpected token < in JSON at position 0 at Object.parse () at ContentRenderer.tsx:26 at ContentRenderer.tsx:60 at u (react-components.esm.js:9) at Wo (react-dom.production.min.js:150) at Oi (react-dom.production.min.js:166) at Ti (react-dom.production.min.js:179) at Fa (react-dom.production.min.js:232) at Ua (react-dom.production.min.js:233) at xu (react-dom.production.min.js:249){code} * The request {color:#00875A}{{instance.atlassian.net/cgraphql?q=QueryPreloader_ContentRendererQuery}}{color} responds with: {code:none}(...)value: "
Error: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Title must not be null or empty.
" (...){code} h3. Workaround Create a Page title only using one line if you want to use a link to this page in another Page.
fields.summary: It's not possible to create links ("/link") to Pages that have titles with a new line.

fields.description:
*Summary*

Currently, user able to bring the table to center when the page is in Fixed-width but if the page Extend content to full-width user not able to bring the table to center.
fields.summary: Option to bring table to center when page is set to full-width.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When "_" is used as heading 6 and is aligned to the right, page sometimes fails to load
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page and enter "_"
 # Set the format as heading 6 and align it to right
 # Publish the page
 # Reload several times

h3. Expected Results
The page will be loaded

h3. Actual Results
For most of the times, after the page loads for a second, an error will be shown.
 !スクリーンショット 2020-02-07 11.48.31.png|thumbnail!
Error's description:
{code:none}

Something went wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support and be sure to give them this code: 6r3bm4.


Reload this page{code}

h3. Notes
* This can also happens with other heading levels, such as h2
* Also happens without aligning the text to right 

h3. Workaround
Avoid using the combination of "_", heading 6, align to right.
fields.summary: When "_" is used as heading, page sometimes fails to load

fields.description:
We are a HIPAA regulated company.  We use Confluence for our brain trust in our organization which includes storing sensitive information (but not PHI).  We would also like to have some Confluence Spaces that allow Anonmymous access to external facing documentation.  The problem is, there isn't really a call out of any kind to the user that a space allows anonymous access (the best I can find right now is putting "PUBLIC" at the start of the space name which is obnoxious.  We want to guard against accidentally exposing sensitive data because the user of Confluence didn't know they were putting sensitive information on a public/anonymous site (you will never know unless you explicitly look at the space permissions).

I was going to try to do this with changing the color of the space but there is no way to do that within Confluence.  The documentation says I have to get a theme editor from the Marketplace but that seems bizarre that I have to use a non Atlassian product change the color on an Atlassian product.  Besides, when I search for theme editor I find anything but that.  So I gave up on that because it is not a hack I want to do.

*New Feature Ideas:*
 * Have a second default theme that is applied to the space if it allows anonymous access.  The theme should be sufficiently different from the global default theme as a basic "hey I am a public space" callout.
 * Anytime a user publishes a page, if the space is anonymous, prompt the user to confirm that they want the content to be publicly available on the Interwebs.  This could be exposed through a Confluence site switch (off by default?) so those who don't care about this don't need to be annoyed by it.

Thank you.  We enjoy using Jira, Jira ServiceDesk and Confluence and are looking at also using OpsGenie.  We appreciate consideration on this request.
fields.summary: Anonymous Space Theme

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you insert a roadmap planner in a page properties macro, any page properties report that displays the those page properties will display the page name text and any other textual properties vertically instead of horizontally.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
1. Create a page with a page properties report and set a label
2. Create a page with the page properties macro, and insert a table for the properties, and insert a roadmap planner macro into the value for at least one property. Set the label on the page.
3. Return to the page with the page properties report and observe that the properties are displayed, however the text is getting styled squished to vertical.

h3. Expected Results

The Page properties report macro grows to fit the content with word breaks instead of character breaks.

h3. Actual Results

The text is broken by character and gets displayed vertically.

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. Inserting the roadmap planner will trigger this issue.
fields.summary: Inserting a roadmap planner in a page properties macro will cause the page properties report to display text vertically

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Confluence search is not returning proper results. In some cases, searching for part of the word won't work, unless the search includes the whole/exact word.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a page on Confluence, and add the string *educational*.
 * Search for *education*.

h3. Expected Results
 * The page should be returned, as it matches the search criteria.

h3. Actual Results
 * The page isn't returned.

h3. Workaround

At this time, the available workaround is to add an asterisk \(\*\) to the partial word.
E.g.: searching for "education*" will return results containing "educational".

Note that wildcards at the beginning of search text are unsupported. See [CONFCLOUD-37153|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-37153] for more information.
fields.summary: Confluence Search not returning results when searching for part of words

fields.description:
If a user doesn't have access to space, we are getting the following error message to contact support.

h3. Suggested Solution

It would be useful if it has a button to Request Access so that Site-Admins could grant access to the required users.
fields.summary: Improve Error Message for Space Permission

fields.description:
Hi,

before upgrade we could normally import a file from local drive and after it the file was uploaded- it looks like this. !image-2020-02-06-11-32-21-948.png|width=229,height=91!

 

Now, after your new version, we cant do it. 

Is possible to implement this functionality, please?

 

Thank you
fields.summary: Cant import a file from external local drive

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Activity Feed in Confluence shows us all the most recent updates that are being done around our sites.
 Though, when someone adds an attachment to the page, like an image, for example, it only shows the file name.

!image-2020-02-05-15-51-33-791.png|width=279,height=213!
h3. Suggestion
 * Instead of showing only the file name, the Activity Log could show us the page where that file was uploaded
fields.summary: Show the page where attachments are being inserted (All Updates Activity)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Both the Popular Labels and Labels List macros will include results for unpublished draft pages. This means that labels on deleted pages will show in this macro, even if the label isn't on any active pages.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new space (starting in a clean space makes it easier to populate the "Popular macros" table)
# On a new page, insert a Popular Labels and a Labels Page macro.
# In the settings of both macros, restrict the results to the current space key.
# Save the page.
# Create another new page, with a template that creates a page with a label (e.g. "Decisions")

h3. Expected Results
The label macros will not show labels that are only on unpublished pages.

h3. Actual Results
The label macros show labels that are on the unpublished draft page. ({{decisions}} label in the case of the "Decisions" template)

h3. Workaround
All users that have a labelled drafts for unpublished pages in the space will need to delete their own drafts
fields.summary: Popular Labels and Labels List macros include labels for unpublished draft pages

fields.description: Currently when a comment is added to text on a Confluence page. The only way to resolve them would be individually. Having an option to "Resolve all" would be extremely helpful.
fields.summary: Resolve All button for Comments on Page.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Was testing a new expand flow from Trello to Confluence in German and everything was in German except for the Confluence onboarding flow. Once onboaridng was finished and I landed in the editor it was and the spotlight onboarding for the editor was translated as well but the initial onboarding screens were not.

These screens:
 !image-2020-02-05-14-27-34-635.png!
Also the first space that it auto creates for the user was all still in English as well

!Screen Shot 2020-02-05 at 2.28.38 pm.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Set your Atlassian account language to German and go through Confluence onboarding
h3. Expected Results

Everything to be in German (all user facing strings)
h3. Actual Results

Some screens have no German at all (initial onboarding flow) and others are a mix of both English and German
h3. Workaround

Learn English.
fields.summary: Confluence onboarding is not translated in German

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

 
I am unable to create pages on hello right now..Clicking publish, causes an infinite spinner.
Add Page - Confluence 2020-02-03 09-41-39.png 
!https://files.slack.com/files-tmb/TE8HJA7RS-FT4V318EM-72ab69b5fc/add_page_-_confluence_2020-02-03_09-41-39_720.png!
 
This worked in another browser and also after I cleared my localStorage in Chrome. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fill up localStorage for your site that confluence is hosted
 # Try and publish a page
 # The page will fail to publish

h3. Expected Results

I would expect that a full localStorage should not prevent core functionality in Confluence from breaking such as Publishing a page.
h3. Actual Results
 
!https://files.slack.com/files-tmb/TE8HJA7RS-FT4V318EM-72ab69b5fc/add_page_-_confluence_2020-02-03_09-41-39_720.png!
 
 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Clear your local storage in the browser you are using.
fields.summary: Unable to publish pages due to localStorage in my browser being full

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Update as of February 7, 2020 10:30AM PST

I’m Elaine from Confluence Product Management. As you may be aware, we’re in the middle of rolling out the [new top navigation|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-articles/New-navigation-and-Home-are-coming-to-Confluence-Cloud/ba-p/1211418] to Confluence Cloud customers.

We recently discovered that some Confluence sites (<2% of all sites) received the new top navigation experience on December 12, 2019 PST, and then it went back to side navigation on January 28, 2020 PST. This is definitely not what we intended and was caused by a bug with a third-party tool we use to release features.

If your site has been affected, it should have the new top navigation re-enabled already. Please note that you now also have the [new Home experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/home-page-979412601.html?_ga=2.138906228.614233913.1573494110-1766198722.1548837854].

We know that sudden changes like this can be disruptive. This is not the way we release features. Please let us know if there’s anything we can do to help.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

If your Confluence site received the new top navigation since December 12, 2019, come back to your Confluence site after January 28, 2020
h3. Expected Results

User should have the new top navigation
h3. Actual Results

User got the old side navigation
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Where did the new top navigation go?!?!

fields.description: As a Confluence space admin, I would like to be able to add emojis to my page *titles* so that I can quickly visually distinguish my different parent pages.
fields.summary: Add emojis to Page titles

fields.description: Confluence Cloud does not allow space keys with any other characters other than alpha numeric ones. Confluence Server does not have such a restriction. So when data is imported from Server to Cloud, it can potentially contain invalid space keys.
fields.summary: Data imported from Server to Cloud contains spaces with invalid keys

fields.description: When hovering over a user that created an inline comment on a page. The commenters Profile information is displayed much too quickly. Having a timed pop-up of a few seconds would Create a much better user experience.
fields.summary: Hover over Mentions/Names in inline comments profile Box

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In a template, when Instructional (aka Placeholder) Text is placed inside of an Excerpt Macro, it will be displayed as part of the (simple) excerpt when the page is called in the Children Display macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a blank page in Confluence using either the legacy or new editor. Save it.
# Create a new template. Add an *Excerpt Macro*. Inside the macro, include some unique +Placeholder Text+ (new editor) or +Instructional Text+ (legacy editor). It does not matter which editor you use.
# Create a page using from that template, and make sure that it's a child of the first page you created. Save.
# Go back to the first parent page, and add a *Children Display* macro. Set *Excerpt Display* setting to *simple*.

h3. Expected Results
Any instructional text on the page should not be displayed as part of the excerpt in Children Display macro. 

h3. Actual Results
Any instructional text placed within the Excerpt Macro will display as a page excerpt in Children Display Macro.

*Notes:*
* So far, this only occurs when the instructional text is placed inside the Excerpt macro. 
* *Rich Content* excerpt on Children Display macro is _not_ affected.

h3. Workaround
(Three options)
# Do not include Placeholder Text in Excerpt Macro.
# Do not display excerpt in Children Display macro.
# If excerpt display is required in Children Display macro, choose *rich content* instead.


Further behavior noticed : 
regardless of selecting any excerpt display selection: none, simple or Rich Content , the placeholder text will be shown in the search result.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Children Display excerpt shows Placeholder Text placed in Excerpt Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Moving issues from Project A to Project B. Then deleting the Project A and changing the project key of Project B to A won't update the Jira issues in Confluence pages. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Project A in Jira
# Add 2 Jira issues in Project A
# Create a Confluence page 
# Insert the 2 Jira issues in Project A to the page
# Create Project B in Jira
# Add 5 Jira issues in Project B 
# Move 2 Jira issues in Project A to Project B
# Delete Project A 

h3. Expected Results
- Moving issues from Project A to Project B. Then deleting the Project A and changing the project key of Project B to A should update the Jira issues in Confluence pages. 

h3. Actual Results
- Moving issues from Project A to Project B. Then deleting the Project A and changing the project key of Project B to A won't update the Jira issues in Confluence pages. 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JIRA Issue Macro Link in Confluence does not change if issue is moved to another project and the source project has been deleted

fields.description:
*Ability to create interactive flow charts within a Confluence Cloud page*

Hello, I would like to create interactive process flowcharts in confluence cloud. The objectives are:
 * Click on a process step and have supporting information related to the step appear next to the flow chart.
 * Where a process flowchart connects to other processes, clicking on those connected processed would open page containing the linked process.

 

Kind regards, 

Paul
fields.summary: Interactive flowchart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the pagination of the Space Directory page, we can click on the grey out "Next" button (last page of the pagination) and an error will be shown.
 !image-2020-02-04-14-20-29-421.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create more than 25 spaces in Confluence
 # Go to Space Directory page: https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action
 # Go to "All spaces" or "Site spaces"
 # Click on *Next* option until the last page
 # Continue to click on the greyed-out *Next* option on the last page
 !image-2020-02-04-14-23-29-854.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
* Nothing happens on the page. A grey-out button should be non-clickable

h3. Actual Results
"An error occurred while searching for spaces." error shown on the page.
 !image-2020-02-04-14-20-29-421.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error Thrown in Space Directory When Clicking on Greyed Out "Next" button

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The indent/outdent button is removed in the new editing experience.
While the shortcut is available, it may not be intuitive enough. It will be great if the button would be brought back.

h3. Workaround
Use the shortcuts:
* indent: tab
* outdent: Shift + tab
fields.summary: Bring back the indent/outdent button to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Confluence allows users to upload ttc or ttf font types fo PDF export languages. However, when exporting to pdf while using the ttc font type an error is thrown that the file type is not a valid TTF tile.

* (Replicable on a MacBook. Due to bug CONFCLOUD-69094 this does not work on windows)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Download the NotoSansCJK.ttc font
# Go to Confluence setting
# Click PDF export language
# Upload the NotoSansCJK.ttc file
# No go to any page and export the page to pdf

h3. Expected Results
The page is exported using the new font

h3. Actual Results
Page fails to export with the error
{code}NotoSansCJK.ttc is not a valid TTF file{code}



h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: PDF export language can't export ttc font

fields.description:
I don't quite understand, why is the editor different when "create new page" vs "edit page"?

I just want to link Jira tickets in the content, and now I have 3 different format in Jira links in 1 article. The user experience is bad.

!image-2020-02-03-14-55-10-101.png!
fields.summary: Inconsistency of editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When searching for worked on through people directory, you can see a few updates made by the user there, however, there is a limited date-range to see it.
It would be useful to be able to see more updates on the people directory by having an option to "see more" or "load more" and order by date.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # open https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/people/search
 # Search for the user on the search for people and teams bar;
 # In the worked on menu, click on view all;
 

h3. Expected Results
You can see all updates done by the user

h3. Actual Results
You can see only a few updates made by the user and there is no option to see more.

h3. Workaround

Access the search (https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/search) of the instance and look for the updates of the user manually.
fields.summary: Increase the date-range of the Activity Logs for individual users on People directory

fields.description:
With the Premium edition of Confluence, the user will be able to use [Analytics|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/analytics-972332388.html] for insights into the content within the application and one of its features is to see the number of created pages by the user. Although this information is useful to know how many pages were created by the user, it could display which pages are those, their current status and then, the number of views per page (as it works in the *Page Analytics* part).

h4.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have a link where it is displayed the number of pages created by the user in order to help with auditing purposes and to reflect the current status of it. Once a user taps in the link, it would display the following:

* A list of the pages and a link to access them. Alternatively, the *Page analytics* function for the corresponding page.
* The status of the pages (e.g. if the page is on the trash, deleted or active, in a space that is archived)
* The total number of views received by a specific user
fields.summary: Improve the list of created pages by a user (Analytics)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Newly created Jira Report Template does not respect Parent-Child hierarchy. 
When you create a page using the Jira report template, then the report does not come under the Parent page(i.e. *JIRA reports*). The page has to be moved manually to the parent page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to any space.
# Create a page using the Jira Report template.
  !image-2020-02-03-20-39-05-944.png|thumbnail! 
# Multiple pages will be created, one of them would be parent page with name: "*JIRA report* " and rest would be the Jira reports.

h3. Expected Results
The Child page *classic pro* should be created under the parent page *JIRA report* by default.
 !image-2020-02-03-20-41-07-699.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-02-03-20-42-01-239.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Actual Results
The child page is created as an individual page.
 !image-2020-02-03-20-42-47-184.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Manually drag the child page(Jira reports) under the parent page(*JIRA reports*).
fields.summary: Newly created Jira Report Template does not respect Parent Child hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- When comparing pages, the format of the table is not kept properly formatted as a table, added/removed rows become completely unreadable.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page insert a table and text on each column and rows
# Publish the page
# Edit the page same page
# Remove some rows and add new text 
# Publish the page
# Compare the two versions

h3. Expected Results
- When comparing pages, the format of the tables is not kept properly formatted as a table added/removed rows become completely unreadable.


h3. Actual Results
- When comparing pages, tables format should be kept properly formatted as a table and should display the correct changes made. 

h3. Workaround
- Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page history comparison displays incorrect difference for changes to a table

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When setting too much fields on *Columns to display* in the Jira Issue/ Filter macro, information such as the JQL used, the display options (Display as Single issue, Total issue count, Table) and Maximum issues will be hidden.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert a Jira Issue/ Filter macro  on the page
# Set any JQL and on display options, insert as many fields as possible on *Columns to display* (tested with 50)

h3. Expected Results
There should be a scroll so the information is not hidden

h3. Actual Results
Information is hidden
|  !Screen Shot 2020-01-31 at 20.59.39.png|thumbnail! |

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Issue/ Filter macro settings won't scroll when too much fields are set on Columns to display

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When converting contents to styled_view using the REST API ({{/rest/api/contentbody/convert/styled_view}}), it returns the content with some css styles applied. But this CSS styles contain a few problems that prevents styling the whole content properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Call the REST API and passing in some body in some content format (i.e., storage format)
 # Validate the returned value

h3. Expected Results

The API returning a proper valid CSS so that the content is styled properly
h3. Actual Results

The CSS returned with the styled content is invalid. Based on my observation, the following issues can be found:
 * The CSS are batched together, but single line comments (i.e., {{// comments}}) are not removed, so there are parts of the css where it's invalid. The whole minified CSS is a single line, so everything after the single line comment is commented out.
 * Some styles are being returned in LESS format instead of regular CSS. (https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-57168)

h3. Workaround

Manually getting the CSS and using that instead of the generated CSS in the styled view response.
fields.summary: Converting content to styled_view using REST API returns invalid css

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When copying the page content from an old editor that contains content that is incompatible with the new editor, the entire Storage format is copied to the new page in the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Copy the content from the old editor
* Paste the content to the new editor page 
* Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
* Page content will get converted in a way corresponding to the New Editor

h3. Actual Results
* The storge Page Source & Storage format is still with old editor, which means, it has nested tables, section macro, column macro, within Panel macro. In edit mode, we see as normal Panel Macro.

h3. Workaround

No workaround possible at the moment.
fields.summary: Copying the content from old editor to new editor copies same Storage format

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
h5. Situation #1:
 - Upon attempting to insert a Roadmap Macro into a page after making editing it, the changes are not saved.

h5. Situation #2:
 - After inserting a new lane, you won't be able to rename the lane right away. You can access the edit screen but it won't' allow you to edit it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. Situation #1:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Spend some time creating the roadmap. (30-40 minutes)
 # Click Insert
 # Occasionally, the changes will not appear on the preview screen. It tends to occur when you've spent a significant amount of time on the roadmap.

h5. Situation #2:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Add a Lane
 # Try to rename the lane that was just added

h3. Expected Results
 - The changes to the roadmap should appear on the preview screen.
 - You should be able to rename the lane after adding.

h3. Actual Results
h5. Situation #1:
 - The changes do not appear in the Preview screen. This behavior is not consistent.

h5. Situation #2:
 - You can access the edit screen but it won't allow you to edit it.

h3. Workaround
h5. Situation #1:

The cause of this is still being investigated. At this time, there is not a known workaround.
h5. Situation #2:
 # Add a Roadmap Planner macro
 # Add a Lane
 # Insert to Roadmap Planner macro
 # Edit the Roadmap Planner macro
 # Then, edit the Lane.

h3. Notes

In the case of changes not appearing as saved, there have been some who have noticed the issue tends to resolve on its own.
fields.summary: Changes not saved when editing Roadmap Planner

fields.description:
With the [new advanced search|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Search-like-a-pro-with-the-new-advanced-search-experience/td-p/1183423], it is no longer possible to search for content created by a specific user. The closest option would be to use the *Contributors* field, but, it will show content that has been edited/updated by the user as well.

This is a suggestion to bring back the *Creator* field as it helps the users to directly see which pages were created by a user when using the search for auditing purposes and to have accuracy when searching for content.

At the moment, the closes workaround would be to manually update the URL to use the legacy search. For example, https://SITE.atlassian.net/wiki/dosearchsite.action.
fields.summary: Bring back the Creator field in the advanced search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, when the user tries to use the [advanced search|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-discussions/Search-like-a-pro-with-the-new-advanced-search-experience/td-p/1183423] without putting any text on the search, it will display results (if a parameter is selected), but, not the number of them.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

For the search without text: 
 # Tap the magnifying glass on the top left of the sidebar;
 # Select *Advanced Search* on the bottom;
 # Make sure to select an option on the parameters of the right side (e.g. Contributor, space);
 # Tap the *Search* button without inserting any text.

Using CQL (Confluence Query Language) conditions:
 # Tap the magnifying glass on the top left of the sidebar;
 # Select *Advanced Search* on the bottom;
 # Insert your search term in the search box *(e.g.: word1 NOT/AND/OR word2)*;
 # Tap the *Search* button and notice that the number of results will not show.

h3. Expected Results

As it happens if the user added any kind of text in the search (without using CQL), the search should display the number of results.
h3. Actual Results

Nothing is displayed, except for the results. A video of the first behavior has been recorded:
 [^search.mp4]
h3. Workaround

For the first scenario, just add a simple letter that would be included in all the results.

For the second scenario, currently, there is no workaround available. We will update it as soon as a valid workaround is found.
fields.summary: Searching without text or using CQL conditions does not show the number of results in Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to create pages from templates if variables are included in templates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a template using variables
 # Step 2 Go to space > click on + icon > select template and try to create a page using a template.
or create a page including button using "Create from template macro" (using a template with variables)

h3. Expected Results
We should be able to create pages using templates.

h3. Actual Results
It will not load editor/ nothing happens.

h3. Workaround

Go to space settings > content and tools > click on "+" icon and select template, it will load the editor without any issue.
fields.summary: Cannot create page from template if variables are used in template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, it is possible for users to be assigned the same Text Cursor color. This causes confusion and makes collaboration harder.

This problem is increased when users have the same first name. In this situation, they can have the same color and letter to describe them within the editor.

Upon testing, it seems that we are able to cycle through ten different colors and the colors can be repeated.

+_The suggested resolution is to keep the editor from assigning the same color for more than one user and increase the color pool from which the system can select._+
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence
 # Edit it with multiple users (preferably more than 10 users)
 # Make sure that Collaborative editing is turned on

 
h3. Expected Results

Every and each user has a different color to describe them
h3. Actual Results

Colors can be repeated, causing confusion:

!RepeatedColorsRepeatedLetters.jpg!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Assign different colors to all users editing a page with collaborative editing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

As of today, users with the same first name will be assigned the same letter to their Collaborative text cursor.

If we take in consideration the behavior we have under [CONFCLOUD-69239|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-69239], the usability of our collaborative editing feature is considerably degraded
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Edit it with multiple users (be sure to have at least two of them with the same first name)

h3. Expected Results

We are able to discern between them easily
h3. Actual Results

Users will be assigned the same initial (first name initial), making it hard to discern between them. 
 If we take in consideration the behavior under [CONFCLOUD-69239|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-69239], it becomes impossible to discern who is editing where.

Example being:

!RepeatedColorsRepeatedLetters.jpg!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Allow users to select which letter will be used in their Collaborative editing text cursor

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently,  line numbers being added automatically when users adding CodeFragment to the confluence page.
fields.summary: Option to remove line numbers on editor

fields.description:
The Instructional text introduced in https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blueprints-and-user-created-templates-724764985.html is not available in the template that uses the new editor.
It would be great if we can use it in the new editor as well.
fields.summary: Bring back the "Instructional text" for templates using the new editor

fields.description:
Hi guys. Would it be possible to create a macro the merges the functionality of the "Attachments" Macro & the "PDF" Macro.

The attachments Macro is frustrating as it lists embedded elements from the page & if you want to view any uploaded PDF Files, you have download it.

The PDF, Office Word, Office Excel & Office PowerPoint Macros are frustrating in that you basically have to create a dedicated page for each file in order to view it effectively.

Ideally I would want a list of uploaded files on the page, & if i select the file, I can view it either on the page or in a new window in the browser. Would be so much more user friendly.

Please advise if this is something you guys could implement in the near future.
fields.summary: Feature Merge of "Attachements" & "PDF" Macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Markdown is supposed to support embedding images.
 E.g
{code:java}
![DOGS](Image URL){code}
The preview window on the Markup macro correctly displays the image, however, after clicking *Insert* the image is not rendered at all, and instead, just plain text is inserted into the page, as can be seen in this next GIF:

!Screen Recording 2020-01-29 at 09.43 AM.gif!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Insert a *Markup* macro;
 # Select *MarkDown* on the macro;
 # Paste this example: ![DOGS]([https://www.sciencemag.org/sites/default/files/styles/article_main_image_-_1280w__no_aspect_/public/dogs_1280p_0.jpg])
 # Check the preview window;
 # Click *Insert*

h3. Expected Results
 * Image to be rendered as the preview window
h3. Actual Results

 * Image is not rendered, and instead just plain text is inserted.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Markdown is not rendering images

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When user clicks on the Keyboard Shortcuts menu, it's not redirecting the user Keyboard Shortcuts menu page.
 !image-2020-01-29-17-31-19-793.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 
Choose the help icon  !image-2020-01-29-17-31-19-793.png|thumbnail! (question) from the navigation bar near your profile picture, then choose Keyboard Shortcuts.

h3. Expected Results

Open keyboard shortcuts page

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Workaround


 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Keyboard Shortcuts menu not working

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-14910].
  {panel}

We would like to able to search for exact text, and not have Lucene tokenise, remove stop words, or do any stemming.

We partly use Confluence as a knowledge base for our own software product, which includes lots of system codes, acrnoyms etc. The specific use case that prompted this was a user wanting to search for the text "S/D". Lucene strips off the 'S', and the '/', leaving the search to just look for 'd'. Not particularly useful.

It would be brilliant if we could enter a query somehow that overrode this. 

Raised following support issue CSP-29584
fields.summary: Provide ability to override Lucene tokenisation and stemming and search for exact text

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a page from template fails when the template keeps the old editor and has a variable in it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click the plus icon and select the template or click the button of "Create from Template" macro that has the template set

h3. Expected Results
A new page will be created

h3. Actual Results
Nothing happens

h3. Workaround
Edit the template and remove the variables
fields.summary: Unable to create page from template if the template is using the old editor and has variable used

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some kinds of pages may have a specific type of unsupported content but they are still migrated to the new editor, breaking the edit mode - the page can't be edited
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In an instance with the legacy editor, create a page with the following storage format:
 [^broken_storage_format.html]
 # Enable the opt-in to the new editor for the instance
 # Try to edit the page

h3. Expected Results

The page shouldn't migrate to the new editor or it  should be editable
h3. Actual Results

The page will try to be edited on the new editor but throws the following error:
{code:java}
Something's gone wrong
Our team has been notified. If the problem persists, please contact Atlassian Support and be sure to give them this code: xxxxxx.
{code}

h3. Workaround
At the moment, you should be able to copy the information out from the original page and paste it into a new one (created with the new editor). We know this is not ideal but it should work.
fields.summary: Pages with some unsupported contents can't be edited after migrated to the new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upon inserting Resolution Time macro and other Jira macros (e.g. Wallboard, etc.), parameter screen does not load. Saving the macro causes _Gadget_ macro to be added, and upon editing the macro, has switched to Activity Stream.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using the new editor.
 # Type */Resolution Time* to insert the macro.
 # You are presented with this screen:
 !CleanShot 2020-01-28 at 16.26.36.png|thumbnail! 
 # (There is no way to enter any parameters.) Click *Save*.
 # A _Gadget_ macro appears in the page. Click it to open the parameter screen again.
 # The macro is now called the *Activity Stream Macro*.

h3. Expected Results
The Resolution Time macro would normally present you with some parameters screen to insert the data you wish to use:
 !CleanShot 2020-01-28 at 16.32.05.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the Developer Console:
{noformat}
Uncaught Error: undefined missing confluence/api/navigator-context 
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
No workaround while using the new editor.
fields.summary: Inserting  Jira macro with slash command adds an Activity Stream instead

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we tried to create a page using the template created for space, after clicking the template nothing happens. The create page dialog just closes itself.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Navigate to a space with custom space templates
* Create a page using a custom template.

h3. Expected Results
* Page will be created using the template.

h3. Actual Results

* Create dialog just close after clicking on Create Button

h3. Workaround

* The page can be created using the template if we stay apart from the page tree. For eg if we navigate to Space Settings page and tries to create the page using the template, the page will be created.

h3. Notes
* It affects only the templates that use variables and use an old editor template.
fields.summary: Cannot create a page using custom page templates for space

fields.description:
Clients who export pages from Confluence Cloud to PDF will gain significant benefit from being able to view the HTML tags (including classes and IDs) being sent by the Fabric editor to the PDF-export engine.

The page source from legacy-editor pages is sent directly to the PDF-export engine, so it is possible to access the HTML tags from the page source and customize the output using the PDF-export stylesheet. This isn't possible for Fabric editor pages, which are pre-processed (to use legacy-editor HTML) before being sent to the PDF-export engine.

It would be extremely beneficial to have some means of viewing the HTML being sent to the PDF engine (in a similar fashion to the way page source can be returned by the Confluence API).
fields.summary: Option to view HTML source sent to PDF-export engine

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Clicking on the task mentioned on a page within the new editor from a task Page doesn't really navigate to the task mentioned on the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Add a task to the New editor Page
* Navigate to Tasks from Settings page.
* Click on the task mentioned in New Editor Page

h3. Expected Results
* Navigated to the position where Task is added

h3. Actual Results
* Navigated to the page only. Need to scroll down to find the mentioned task

h3. Workaround

* Scroll down the page to view the mentioned task
fields.summary: Clicking on Tasks from Tasks page doesn't position to the mentioned task in New Editor

fields.description: Confluence should allow for virus scanning of attachments, which could then be rejected if viruses were found.
fields.summary: Virus Scan Attachments

fields.description:
h3. *Current Situation*
- This page displays formatting options for place holder texts in Excerpt macro, as can be seen in this next screenshot is no longer available in the new editor. 

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 16.46.01.png|thumbnail! 
 !Screen Shot 2019-10-30 at 16.17.13.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggestion
- Bring back excerpt macro's page displays formatting options for place holder texts
fields.summary: Bring back excerpt macro's page displays formatting options for place holder texts

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a page is added using the link macro, publishing the page breaks the editor if the title of the page has *Umlaut* in it. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Edit a page
 * Add a page link which has Umlaut in it, using the link macro, 
 * Publish the page

h3. Note: 

The issue is observed in EMail notifications as well, any *Umlaut* is replaced with special charecters 
h3. Expected Results
 * The page will be published without any error.

h3. Actual Results
 * The editor breaks with the error  *We couldn't load your editor* 

h3. Workaround
 * Either remove the Umlaut from the title, or recreate the title and publish the page.
fields.summary: Umlaut in the Title causes the Page to break

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If the *Page Properties* macro is placed inside a *expand* macro on a page, then the information will not be displayed properly(column name/column data displayed vertically)
h3. Replication steps:
 # Create a page and add a *expand macro*.
 !image-2020-01-28-13-12-59-591.png|thumbnail!
 # insert a *page properties report* macro inside *expand macro*.
 !image-2020-01-28-13-13-19-884.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected result:

The *Page Properties Report* should display the content/the table column data *horizontally*.
 !image-2020-01-28-13-14-25-653.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual result:

The *Page Properties Report* displaying the content/the table column data *vertically*.
 !image-2020-01-28-13-14-53-953.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Place the *Page Properties macro* outside of the *expand macro*. The Page Properties Report will display the data correctly.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro can't display content properly if the Page Properties macro is placed inside a Expand Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If there is a table inside of a table of contents zone macro, the same keeps the table in the legacy editor, even if the editor/page is the new editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in the new editor
 # Insert the table of contents zone macro
 # Insert a table inside the table of contents zone macro
 # Create another table outside of the table of the contents macro

h3. Expected Results
Both tables are equal and there is no difference between then, both being on the new editor's design.
h3. Actual Results
The table inside the table of contents macro is on the legacy editor.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Table of contents zone macro is not converting table to the new editor

fields.description:
Replicate the Background Color Macro function in the New Editor. Add these functions to the Table Editor if necessary since that has been offered at the replacement. 

The functionality desired included: 
 * The ability to set up a background color for a Section (possibly replicated by the table editor, but it is not quite the same.)
 * The ability to specify the color using a Hex Code, so that any color can be used, not a predefined palette. (Table editor has a very limited set of predefined colors. ) 
 * The ability to use a very dark background color and use WHITE for the color of the text. (the New Editor does not offer white as a text color.)
fields.summary: Replicate Background Color Macro functionality in the New Editor

fields.description: Currently it's not possible to indent text in the quote macro. This is a functionality that was available previously and would be helpful to have in the new editor.
fields.summary: Indent quotes in the new editor
Allow Anchors to be specified anywhere in a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Noticed something funky on the Manage apps page in relations to top nav, where certain elements, like the "User-installed" drop down are showing through the top nav when scrolling through a page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a production instance with Nav v3, as a Confluence admin, navigate to Manage apps in Confluence Settings.
 # Under the User-installed apps section, click the chevron icon to expand each app's details
 # Scroll down on the screen and observe the top nav section

h3. Expected Results

Nothing should show through the top nav.
h3. Actual Results

Parts of the Manage apps screen show through top nav. See screen motion capture here: https://youtu.be/02r4zT2bcMQ

 
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Admin Settings Manage apps screen shows through top nav when scrolling down on it

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we are a space admin, we do not always want to notify or let users as watchers on our space. Though we can easily [manage the watchers|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/manage-watchers-724765356.html] on our spaces, we do not have a way to prevent users to add themselves as watchers on the content we administer.

h3. Suggestion
* Add a permission, in the space level, that allows us to let users/groups add themselves as watchers or not.
fields.summary: Disable "Watchers" option on spaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a Jira issue macro link is copied from Old editor to New editor, it is displaying as an image.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira issue macro with old editing experience in Confluence page -  !image-2020-01-27-21-20-22-881.png|width=415,height=102!
 # Copy this Jira issue macro in a Confluence page with new editor -  !image-2020-01-27-21-22-05-633.png|width=211,height=95!

h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue macro should appear as macro link in new editor as well.
h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue macro link copied from old editor is appearing as an image at new editor.
h3. Workaround

Instead of copy paste the Jira issue link, the user need to insert a Jira macro in new editor and add link to the Jira issue.
fields.summary: Jira issue macro displays as image when copied from old to new editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Some blueprints/templates are not creating their index pages and shortcuts upon publishing them.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a template/blueprint with the Customer Interview
 # Publish the page


h3. Expected Results
The index page should be published and the shortcut should be on the left panel

h3. Actual Results
The index page is not created, nor the shortcut

Notes: 
* Templates not creating index pages:
* Customer interview report
* Capacity plan
* Competitive analisys
* Goals, signals, measures
* IT Project Poster
* Marketing Blog Post
* Marketing Campaign
* Marketing Plan
* Message House
* My user manual
* OKRs
* persona
* product launch
* project plan
* project poster
* stakeholder communications

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Template's Index not being created

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When editing a page in Confluence with too much content, text takes around 5-10 secs to show up after typing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a page with a lot of content (more than 30 tables, many numbered lists, and many content)
# Open the edit mode
# Start to edit the page

h3. Expected Results
Click on any place in the page and type without problems.

h3. Actual Results
Click on any place in the page, start to type and there is a delay. When you start typing, the first letters appears without problems, then, they stop. After sometime, what you typed is showed.

h3. Notes
We're able to reliably reproduce the issue with the following storage format:
 [^CONFCLOUD-69192.html] 

h3. Workaround
Break the page in smaller pages.
fields.summary: Delay editing a page with too much content

fields.description:
In Confluence, the user has the ability to [create global and space templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/blueprints-and-user-created-templates-724764985.html] in order to have brand new pages created from it.

When the user inserts specific macros to those templated (while editing it), some of them will display messages that those only work on pages, like the example below, used for the Children Display and Page Tree macros:

!macros.png|thumbnail!

In fact, those macros do not display the proper content while on the edit mode of the template, but, once a new page is created based on it, it will properly display the macro results.

h4.Suggestion

Since the macros will be displayed on the pages using it, instead of displaying a message leading the user to believe that the macro does not work, it could be a bit clearer with messages like the following:
{quote}
"This macro will be only visible when a page is created using this template."
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve the message for macros in the template editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the Cloud instance is renamed (CLOUD-7184), all the Jira Gadgets on Confluence will break.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create some Jira Gadgets on Confluence
 # Rename the instance

h3. Expected Results

Jira Gadgets should automatically continue to work after renaming without human intervention.
h3. Actual Results

Jira gadgets will break, showing the following error on the page:
{code:none}
Error rendering macro 'gadget' : The gadget at https://instance_name.atlassian.net/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml was not added to this Confluence instance yet.{code}
h3. Workaround

Open a support request through [https://support.atlassian.com/contact] mentioning this bug report so we can update all the gadgets at once.
fields.summary: Renaming the instance will break the Jira gadgets on Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new editing experience has a feature that allows us to insert and create [custom emojis|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/confluence-editing-improvements-945107733.html#ConfluenceEditingImprovements-Fullsuiteofunicodeemojisandcustomemojiuploads] to our site. Though this is a cool functionality, we do not have a way to administer it in a manner that allows us to decide whether a user/group can or cannot add custom emojis, in order to keep the compliance of our companies and avoid the addition of inappropriate content.

h3. Suggestion
* Add a permission scheme at the space or site level that allows us to decide which users/groups can add custom emojis;
* Or allows site-admins to adminster custom emojis such as on Slack, for example, where it provides us with an entire view of all the custom emojis added to the instance, with an option to remove them.
fields.summary: Add an option to disable Custom Emojis

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While PDF export in *Fabric Editor*, if we want to apply CSS on a few macros like (success, code, panel, info, warning, error) then the classes/tags are not correctly defined i.e. If we inspect and check the class of the particular macro and apply CSS on that particular class then it does not work.

It worked well in the old editor.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Page with Fabric Editor.
# Put any macro among success, code, panel, info, warning, error.
# Inspect the macro as shown in the below screenshot.
 !image-2020-01-24-15-57-28-304.png|thumbnail! 
# And now, apply CSS on these classes as shown in the below screenshot.
 *+.ak-editor-panel__content+{border: solid yellow 2px; background-color: red;}*
# Get PDF Export of the page and you will see that CSS isn't got applied on the macro, but now apply CSS on below class:
*+.confluence-information-macro-information+{border: solid yellow 2px; background-color: red;}*

h3. Expected Results
The result should be visible when the CSS was applied to the class *.ak-editor-panel__content*.

h3. Actual Results
The info macro was affected by the CSS when it was applied to another class *.confluence-information-macro-information*(this class was there for info macro back in the old editor).

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wrong classes assigned for a few macros (PDF export)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
- Currently, it's only possible to embed a Code Snippet within a panel  (Note, Sucess, Warning,  or Error) but only when it is added to a list (bullets or numbering). 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Insert an Info panel 
# Embed a Code Snippet within the panel 

h3. Expected Results
- It should be possible to embed a code snippet within the panel without being added as an item in a list. 

h3. Actual Results
- It is only possible to embed a Code Snippet within a panel when you add it as an item in a list. 
- If you attempt to insert a Code Snippet in a panel without it being an item in a list, it simply drops below the panel.

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Code Snippet can't be added to Info Panel (Note, Success, Warning,  or Error)
Files from diagram add-ons are not showing in the Recent Uploads list

fields.description:
As a site administrator, the user should be able to create personal spaces for each Confluence user, based on their needs. 
when we create personal space we should get options:
Space Name:
Space Key:
Owner Name:

Once we create space it should be created in the owner personal space with private access only the person owning the space will have access.
fields.summary: Ability to create personal space for other user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some items in the new editor do not style the same as they do when the page is published.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Create a new page
 # Step 2. On the new page, add a "heading 1" header with any text.
 # Step 3. Beneath the header, add a layout object with no whitespace between the header and the layout object
 # add any content to the layout object
 # publish the page

h3. Expected Results
 The page will match style and spacing as from the editor.

h3. Actual Results

The Header 1 will be styled differently and there will be a space between the header and the section (in the form of top padding CSS style).

h3. Workaround

There is no workaround. There are some items that just are styled somewhat differently in the viewer from the editor.
fields.summary: The new editor styling on some items does not match the published page style

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The table in a Page properties macro does not respect the width of the container which is the parent of the page properties macro. For example, if you insert a page properties macro into the left-side area of a layout and then change the distribution of width of that layout, the table will not shrink the width when less space is available, and the macro produces a scroll bar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1. Create a page and add a layout
 # Step 2. In the layout's left side cell, add a page properties macro
 # Step 3. In the page properties macro add a table, set the column header setting, unset the row header setting and remove the third column so that you only have the header and a data column.
 # Step 4. Fill out the table with some data, then start changing the balance of the layout.

h3. Expected Results

The table width does not have a scrollbar and the table width fits the layout like if it was not in a page properties macro.

h3. Actual Results

The width of the table does not shrink (it will grow for some reason) and a scrollbar will show up for the table, even if it doesn't need the space.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround other than to have the page properties macro not in a layout.
fields.summary: Table in a Page properties macro does not respect the width of the parent container

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the old editor, we had the possibility to create a list (numbered or bulleted) and use the header options for each item on this list - that's no longer possible to be done in the new editor.

h3. Suggestion
Bring this feature back in the new editing experience according to what it was in the old one.
fields.summary: Allow to insert headers on bulleted/numbered lists

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Sometimes we use the *Roadmap Planner* macro to create great roadmaps in order to keep on track our work. When a roadmap gets too vertically extended and we have to scroll the page down to see the bottom information, the roadmap header where we can see the months/weeks disappear and we have to keep scrolling up and down to match the correct information.

h3. Suggestion
* Add the option to keep the monthly/weekly periods as a fixed header when the roadmap gets big enough to be scrolled.
fields.summary: Fixed monthly/weekly periods on Roadmap Planner macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When attaching a video on a Confluence page, it is not possible to reproduce it when accessing the page via Confluence Mobile app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page;
# Attach a video file;
# Publish the page;
# On the Confluence Mobile app (Android or iOS), access the page you just created.

h3. Expected Results
The video is there and ready to be reproducible.

h3. Actual Results
The video is shown as an image
*OR*
it doesn't even appear in the view mode.

*Notes*:
It is possible to see the video attached to the page accessing the editing mode, but it won't reproduce anyway.

h3. Workaround
You can access this page using the mobile browser in order to reproduce the video.
fields.summary: Cannot reproduce attached videos on mobile app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the user clicks on the hyperlink in Table of contents macro, the page did not bring the user to the expected header instead it jumps to the top of the page in the Edge browser. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Open confluence in Edge browser
 # Add a few headers and text
 # Add table content macro
 # Click on one of the links

h3. Expected Results

When the user click the hyperlink, it will bring user to the expected header.


h3. Actual Results

The page did not bring the user to the expected header instead it jumps to the top of the page

h3. Workaround

Use other browsers such as Chrome and Firefox.
fields.summary: Table of Contents macro hyperlinks jumping back to top of page in Edge browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When pasting multi-level numbered or bullet lists in Confluence New Editor, the formatting is stripped due to Confluence auto-format.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use  [^Bullet List.docx] as an example.

h4. Paste in New Editor Example (x)
 !WordPasteNEW.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Paste in Old Editor Example (/)
 !WordImportOLD.png|thumbnail! 

Confirmed that a similar behavior occurs when pasting from Pages application instead, but not from other applications, such as Notes on macOS.

h3. Expected Results
The original formatting should be retained when pasting into the new editor, much as it does when using Paste and Match Style. 

h3. Actual Results
Confluence's new editor does not retain the formatting when pasting a list. Appears that this may be due to auto-formatting.

h3. Workaround
Paste without formatting, or import as Word document:
 
h4. Paste and Match Style (/)
!PasteandMatchStyleNEW.png|thumbnail!

h4. Import Word Document Old Editor (/)
!WordImportOLD.png|thumbnail!

h4. Import Word Document New Editor (/)
!WordImportNEW.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

h4. Paste from Notes application (/)
!NotesBulletList.png|thumbnail! 

h4. Paste Tabbed Lines Instead (/)
!PasteTabbedLines.png|thumbnail! 

Possibly related to the auto-formatting issues in CONFCLOUD-68744
fields.summary: Pasting multi-level lists strips formatting

fields.description:
Currently, if a user copy and paste a private repository URL in a confluence page with P whitelisting enabled in bitbucket and it asked for "link accounts" in confluence error:You don't have permissions to view Try another account". They are required to whitelist the whole IP ranges belongs to the confluence cloud.

Adding all the Confluence ip's to the Bitbucket whitelist and to keep it updated is a lot of work. Can't the IP whitelisting feature be overridden in such edge cases?
fields.summary: Cloning repository from bitbucket to confluence is restricted if IP whitelisting is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence Mobile app for Android, the Overview/Homepage will not show if the space doesn't have pages yet. The Overview page is visible when using the Confluence Mobile app for iOS.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space (blank template)
 # Access the space using the Confluence Mobile app for Android

h3. Expected Results
 - Overview/Homepage should be visible when viewing an empty space in the Confluence Mobile app for Android.

h3. Actual Results
 - Overview/Homepage is not visible when viewing an empty space in the Confluence Mobile app for Android.

h3. Workaround
- Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Mobile app does not show Overview of an empty space

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The new editor does not render the page "view source" properly.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a page created with the new editor
# Click the top right ellipsis *...*
# Select view source

h3. Expected Results
The page source is rendered correctly

h3. Actual Results
The page source is rendered without keeping the content structure

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page view source not rendered properly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the old editing experience, it was possible to use the intention buttons in the top toolbar to indent text within tables or in the page at all - this is no longer an option for when we want to insert indentation on our text withing a table.
Hitting the *TAB* keyboard key only works for content that is not inside a table. Hitting *TAB* from withing a table leads you to the next cell.

h3. Suggestion
Adding a button that allows you to add text indentation inside table cells.
fields.summary: Add indentation on table cells

fields.description: Sort the pages in the 'page properties report' macro in the sort order of the main/left(page navigation) menu
fields.summary: Sort the pages in the 'page properties report' macro in the sort order of the main/left(page navigation) menu

fields.description: In Safari (but not Chrome) there's a black bar running down the left nav while collapsed. A bit of mousing around expand/collapse jiggery pokery gets rid of it, but it comes back on refresh. Seems to happen on all pages.
fields.summary: Black bar on collapsed left nav in Safari
